statements: SELECT * FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE user_id > 5;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role = 'guest' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users WHERE role = 'user';
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role = 'customer';
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT username FROM users WHERE role = 'admin' ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT user_id, password FROM users WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE description IS NOT NULL;
SELECT permission_id, permission_name FROM permissions ORDER BY permission_id;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE user_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT u.username, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN permissions p ON u.user_id = p.permission_id;
SELECT u.username, COUNT(p.permission_id) AS num_permissions FROM users u LEFT JOIN permissions p ON u.user_id = p.permission_id GROUP BY u.username HAVING COUNT(p.permission_id) > 1;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role FROM users ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM users ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role='admin';
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE role_id = 2 ORDER BY permission_name DESC;
SELECT user_id, password FROM users WHERE role='user' AND username LIKE '%john%';
SELECT * FROM roles INNER JOIN permissions ON roles.role_id = permissions.role_id WHERE role_name = 'admin';
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE role IN ('admin', 'guest') ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'J%';
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE role IN ('admin', 'user');
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN permissions p ON r.role_id = p.role_id;
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u LEFT JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id LEFT JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id WHERE r.role_name = 'Manager';

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u RIGHT JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id RIGHT JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id LEFT JOIN permissions p ON r.role_id = p.role_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT role_id, role_name, description FROM roles WHERE role_name LIKE '%manager%';
SELECT user_id, role_id FROM user_roles WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users ORDER BY role DESC;

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id;
SELECT u.username, COUNT(ur.role_id) as total_roles FROM users u LEFT JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id GROUP BY u.user_id;
